Example

Use the inverse matrix method to solve \[\begin{matrix} 2x_1 & + & 3x_2 & = & 3 \\ 5x_1 & + & 4x_2 & = & 11 \\ \end{matrix} \]

Solution

The system in \(AX=B\) form is \[\left[\begin{matrix}2&3\\5&4\end{matrix}\right] \left[\begin{matrix}x_1\\x_2\end{matrix}\right]=\left[\begin{matrix}3\\11\end{matrix}\right] . \] We have \(|A|=2\times 4-3\times 5=-7 \neq 0\) and therefore \(A^{-1}\) exists. We can now compute \[A^{-1}=-\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{matrix}4&-3\\-5&2\end{matrix}\right] . \] Using \(X=A^{-1}B\), we have \[X=\left[\begin{matrix}x_1\\x_2\end{matrix}\right]=-\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{matrix}4&-3\\-5&2\end{matrix}\right] \left[\begin{matrix}3\\11\end{matrix}\right]=-\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{matrix}4\times 3-3\times 11\\-5\times 3+2\times 11\end{matrix}\right]=-\dfrac{1}{7}\left[\begin{matrix}-21\\7\end{matrix}\right]= \left[\begin{matrix}3\\-1\end{matrix}\right] .\] Therefore, \(x_1=3,\ x_2=-1\).
